III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Agency was reminded that end date of the report should not extend beyond
the signature date. Two reports reviewed were completed and signed timely,
however the end date of the reporting period extended beyond the signature
date.
• The Environmental Inspection resulted in an A rating, however noted that per
licensing rule R.400.8325(d), the agency needs to ensure the addition of a 3rd
compartment. If manual washing method is to be used in the 2-compartment
sink, it must allow for WASH-RINSE-SANITIZE. The agency was advised that

a 3rd compartment must be available for complete submission for sanitizing
and adequate drain board.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency did not request and require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAPS) during
this licenisng period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2023 Interiem: Corrective Action Pan was recorded during this reporting period as
a result of the inspection completed on 09/20/2023. The CAP contained one
violation of CCI Rule 400.4113 in that there was one of four new employee files
reviewed that did not have three letters of reference. The CAP contained action steps
to ensure re-training of all hiring staff and the use of an enhanced checklist. The CAP
was completed, and compliance achieved by the agency.
Special Investigation 2024C0000858SI with CAP approval date of 12/27/2023 was a
result of the agency’s failure to notify DCWL of law enforcement contact with youth in
the program and failure to report AWOL status of a youth and complete an incident
report. The agency has completed action steps of CAP.
Financial Overview
Beverly House is operated under Spectrum Human Services. Spectrum Human
Service Inc. is a 501(c)3. Their financial audit was reviewed and found fiscally
sound.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was received and reviewed on 07/29/2024.
Assessment indicates there were not any barriers or systemic factors impacting
rule compliance. Beverly House staff continue to work toward enhancing

treatment for youth in the program and specifically motivating the youth to attend
and participate in clinical intervention.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A total of four staff were interviewed. The direct care staff were relatively new but
reported optimism about working for the agency and providing structure and
support to the youth. Staff were able to explain policy and procedures for Beverly
House. No concerns were reported.
Three youths were interviewed at Beverly House. The youth provided positive
feedback about the program and interactions with staff. No areas of concern were
reported by the youth.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on 7/23/2024. There
were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
